definition.value: quantification of some aspect of an individual's micrbiome of the gut
quantification of excessive daytime sleepiness such as how often it occurs and its severity
quantification of insomnia such as how often it occurs and its severity
quantification of some aspect of risky sexual behaviour such as frequency of unprotected sexual intercourse and number of sexual partners within a given time frame
quantification of some aspect of alcohol consumption such as frequency or quantity
quantification of some aspect of job-related exhaustion such as severity or duration
quantification of some aspect of an individual's microbiome
quantification of the taxonomic variation in a microbiome sample
quantification of the functional variation in a microbiome
measurement of the repolarisation phase of the heart's electrical cycle, defined as the difference between the duration of the QT interval and duration of the QRS interval
quantification in a sample of the organochlorine pesticide dichlorodiphenyltrichloroethane (DDT) or any metabolite derived from DDT, eg 2, 2-bis (4-chlorophenyl)-1, 1-dichloroethene (p,p′-DDE)
The age of onset of (human) voice drop, the deepening of the voice of adolescents as they reach puberty
quantification of some aspect of dysmenorrheic pain (menstrual cramps), such as their severity or duration
quantification of adipose tissue located around the heart

quantification of epidermal permeability barrier status, for example using transepidermal water loss, the passive diffusion of water from the hydrated layers of the dermis and epidermis towards those layers with a lower water content
quantification of the effect of the donor genotype on the success of an organ or tissue transplant
quantification in a sample (eg blood) of alpha-carotene, the second most common form of carotene, with a β-ionone ring at one end and an α-ionone ring at the opposite end

quantification in a sample (eg blood) of beta-carotene, an organic, strongly colored red-orange pigment abundant in plants and fruits. Among the carotenes, β-carotene is distinguished by having beta-rings at both ends of the molecule. β-Carotene is biosynthesized from geranylgeranyl pyrophosphate.

quantification in a sample (eg blood) of lutein, a xanthophyll and one of 600 known naturally occurring carotenoids. Lutein is synthesized only by plants and like other xanthophylls is found in high quantities in green leafy vegetables such as spinach, kale and yellow carrots.

quantification in a sample (eg blood) of zeaxanthin, one of the most common carotenoid alcohols found in nature and the pigment that gives paprika, corn, saffron, wolfberries, and many other plants and microbes their characteristic color

quantification in a sample (eg blood) of cryptoxanthin, a carotenoid closely related in terms of structure to beta-carotene and that has been isolated from a variety of sources including the petals and flowers of plants in the genus Physalis, orange rind, papaya, egg yolk, butter, apples, and bovine blood serum
quantification in a sample of alpha-tocopherol, a form of vitamin E that is preferentially absorbed and accumulated in humans
quantification in a sample of gamma-tocopherol
quantification in a sample (eg blood) of retinol, a vitamin A retinoid synthesized from the breakdown of β-carotene
quantification of the ratio of hepcidin to ferritin in a sample
quantification of the ratio of hepcidin to transferrin saturation, the amount of iron bound to transferrin, in a sample
quantification of the ratio of magnesium to calcium in a sample, typically a urine sample, a proxy measure for the differential handling by the renal tubule and excretion of Ca2+ and Mg2+

label.value: susceptibility to childhood ear infection measurement

definition.value: quantification of an individual's susceptibility to childhood ear infections, generally as a count of number of infections suffered or a binary scale of presence or absence of childhood ear infections

quantification of the severity of joint hypermobility, for example using the Beighton score, a score ranging from 0 to 9 based on 9 different measurements regarding the hypermobility of finger, knee, elbow, thumb and hip hypermobility
quantification of some aspect of unibrows, such as their presence or absence, or their severity
quantification of some aspect of methadone dosage
quantification of some aspect of air pollution through traffic, such as annual average NO2 exposure estimates derived using land use regression modeling
quantification of the amount of chromogranin A cleavage product in a sample
quantification of the amount of chromogranin B cleavage product in a sample
quantification of some aspect of personality traits, usually through administration of standardised questionnaire such as the Big Five Inventory (BFI)
quantification of conscientiousness, usually through administration of standardised questionnaire such as the Big Five Inventory (BFI)
quantification of extraversion, usually through administration of standardised questionnaire such as the Big Five Inventory (BFI)
quantification of openness, usually through administration of standardised questionnaire such as the Big Five Inventory (BFI)
quantification of agreeableness, usually through administration of standardised questionnaire such as the Big Five Inventory (BFI)

Quantification an individual's risk of undergoing tonsillectomy. Some individuals experience recurrent, severe tonsillitis and massive hypertrophy of the tonsils in which case surgical removal of the tonsils may be considered. There are a number of genetic variants that may reduce the risk of tonsillectomy by conferring a protective effect.

quantification of the severity of schizophrenia symptoms, for example as a result of treatment. Schizophrenia symptom severity can be evaluated via a range of measures, including the the Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS), a medical scale used for measuring symptom severity of patients with schizophrenia, the PANSS sub-component PANSS positive Marder factor score and PANSS negative Marder factor score and the Clinical Global Impression – Severity scale (CGI-S), a 7-point scale that requires the clinician to rate the severity of the patient's illness at the time of assessment, relative to the clinician's past experience with patients who have the same diagnosis.
quantification in an electrocardiogram of the number of QRS complexes per minute
quantification of the ratio of  triglyceride to HDL cholesterol in a sample
quantification of the ratio of LDL cholesterol to HDL cholesterol in a sample
quantification of the ratio of non-HDL cholesterol to HDL cholesterol in a sample

Quantification of the susceptibility of developing multiple keratinocyte carcinomas (mKC), which is defined as the presence of more than one basal cell carcinoma (BCC) or squamous cell carcinoma (SCC).
mineral density of the radial bone

The clearance rate of creatinine, that is, the volume of plasma that is cleared of creatinine by the kidneys per unit time. Creatinine clearance is calculated using the level of creatinine in a sample of urine, usually one collected over a period of 24 hours, the corresponding plasma creatinine level, and the volume of urine excreted. It is used as an approximation of the glomerular filtration rate (GFR).

label.value: urinary uric acid to creatinine ratio

definition.value: quantification of the ratio of uric acid to creatinine in a urine sample
quantification of some aspect of disease prognosis
